question.title: JBeret extension to deliver metrics
question.body:
We want to monitor metrics on our Jakarta Batch jobs processed through JBeret. That means we want to count all invocations of reader/processor/writer, all listeners, all loops executed in Batchlets and even across partitions. Such functionality is not application centric so I desire this information gathered by the framework.

JBeret or the Jakarta Batch specification provides some metrics at the end of a chunk which is good but does not cover all that I need.

What way is provided by JBeret to attach such functionality? Or would I have to customize JBeret, or even consider switching to another Jakarta Batch implementation that provides the metrics or extensibility?

question_comments.body: Am running Java SE with JBeret. Weld SE is in the picture and might do some good. A batch listener does not provide any help within chunks, partitions or on listeners. The interceptor is something I need to test. @BatchProperty does not get injected before `@PostConstruct so it's a bit fiddely.
Are you running under a specific server like WildFly? You might be able to use a CDI interceptor or use a batch listener.
